name: ring0cl
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c0, cgrp))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ Ring, c1 ∈ c2, c0 ∈ Grp)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c0, cgrp))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Ring → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Ring → c0 ∈ Grp)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Grp → c1 ∈ c2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c0, cgrp))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Ring → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Ring → c0 ∈ Grp)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Grp → c1 ∈ c2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Ring → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Grp → c1 ∈ c2)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c0g, c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c0g, c0))

comment: The zero element of a ring belongs to its base set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jan-2014.)
